caption.title: Genes up- and down-regulated in injured trigeminal neurons.
caption.p: Genes that are affected by IOT were identified by comparing expression in the two injured neuron classes relative to other classes. (a) Selected up-regulated genes, their proposed functional role and previous assignment as injury-related transcripts (Cobos et al., 2018; Guan et al., 2016; Shin et al., 2019; Wlaschin et al., 2018) and/or as genes involved in neural regeneration (Mahar and Cavalli, 2018). (b) Selected down-regulated genes, their functional classification and previous assignment as injury-related transcripts (Shin et al., 2019). See Supplementary file 2; Supplementary file 3; Supplementary file 4 for more information about genes expression changes in injured neurons including magnitude of changes and probability that expression is altered and Figure 2—figure supplement 3 for GO-analysis.

tr.td: Transcriptional regulation: (up and downregulation) ATF/CREB family of transcription factors
Semaphorin: receptor for Plxna2 role in cell-cell signaling and appropriate neural projection
Transcription factor: regulates survival and axonal growth in embryonic sensory neurons
Neuropeptide: modulation and inhibition of action potentials
Neuropeptide: neuropeptide with multiple roles including reducing pain perception
Headless myosin: roles in development and cell migration
Receptor for GDNF: promotes neural survival and differentiation of neurons
Signaling: negative feedback regulator of transforming growth factor
Ligand-gated ion channel subunit: kainate receptor type 1
Signal transduction: protein kinase c alpha
Ion channel: Trpc3 linked to mechanosensory transduction
Sodium ion channel subunit: Nav1.8 linked to pain sensation in humans and mice
Sodium ion channel subunit: Nav1.7 linked to pain sensation in humans and mice
Sodium ion channel subunit: Nav1.1 linked to pain sensation in humans and mice
Neuropeptide: CGRP, role in neuroinflammation and pain
Neuropeptide: substance P, acts as a neurotransmitter/modulator, role in pain
Ion channel: Trpm3 linked to pain signaling in mice
G protein coupled receptor: mu-opioid receptor
Synaptosome associated protein: role in neurotransmitter release

fn.p: 1Upregulated after SNI (a) Shin et al. (2019), (b) Wlaschin et al. (2018), (c) Cobos et al. (2018).
2Role in neural regeneration (D) Mahar and Cavalli (2018).
